source_books: Mixed Martial Arts: Book of Knowledge
training_philosophy: Power development, cardiovascular conditioning, and technical skill integration
evidence_base: Professional fighter preparation and combat sports research

exercises.scientific_explanation: Heavy bag training develops punching power through kinetic chain coordination from ground up. Dempsey's biomechanical analysis shows force generation begins with ground reaction forces, transfers through leg drive, hip rotation, trunk rotation, and finally arm extension. Elite boxers generate 4000-5000N peak forces.
research_citations: Piorkowski et al. (2011): Boxing punch biomechanics
Walilko et al. (2005): Force analysis in boxing
exercises.performance_metrics: Power output, punch speed, combination fluency
exercises.form_cue: Drive from back foot, rotate hips and shoulders, punch through target
exercises.common_mistake: Arm-only punching reduces force generation by 60-70%

exercises.scientific_explanation: Sprawls develop the explosive hip extension and defensive movement patterns essential for takedown defense in MMA. Research shows improvements in hip mobility, core strength, and defensive reaction time when trained systematically.
research_citations: James et al. (2013): MMA conditioning demands
exercises.performance_metrics: Explosive speed, defensive position quality, endurance capacity
exercises.form_cue: Explosive hip snap back, hands to ground, return to fighting stance
exercises.common_mistake: Slow hip movement or not returning to proper fighting position

exercises.scientific_explanation: Medicine ball slams develop the explosive core power essential for striking and throwing in combat sports. Research shows power outputs comparable to Olympic lifts when performed at 10-15% body weight, with direct transfer to striking power and grappling strength.
research_citations: Stockbrugger & Haennel (2003): Medicine ball power development
exercises.performance_metrics: Maximum velocity, power output, technique maintenance under fatigue
exercises.form_cue: Full body explosion, slam with maximum force, follow through completely
exercises.common_mistake: Using arms only instead of full kinetic chain power

exercises.scientific_explanation: Shadow boxing integrates technical skill practice with cardiovascular conditioning while developing fight-specific movement patterns. Research shows improvements in punching accuracy, combination fluency, and fight conditioning when performed with proper intensity and technique focus.
research_citations: Chaab√®ne et al. (2014): Combat sports conditioning
exercises.performance_metrics: Technique quality, combination speed, movement fluency
exercises.form_cue: Visualize opponent, maintain proper stance, technical precision
exercises.common_mistake: Sloppy technique or not visualizing realistic opponent movements

exercises.scientific_explanation: The Turkish get-up develops the ground-to-standing transition strength essential for grappling and ground fighting. Research shows improvements in shoulder stability, core strength, and transitional movement patterns crucial for MMA and wrestling performance.
exercises.performance_metrics: Smooth transition quality, load progression, movement efficiency
exercises.form_cue: Move deliberately through each position, maintain arm vertical throughout
exercises.common_mistake: Rushing through positions or not maintaining proper alignment

exercises.scientific_explanation: Speed bag training develops hand-eye coordination, timing, and punching accuracy while improving shoulder endurance. Research shows improvements in reaction time and punching precision when incorporated into boxing training protocols.
research_citations: Davis et al. (2015): Coordination training in boxing
exercises.form_cue: Maintain rhythm, keep hands up, eye tracking
exercises.common_mistake: Hitting too hard or not maintaining consistent rhythm
